intro: Penstemon procerus var. aberrans, commonly known as the long-spurred penstemon, is a striking perennial plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, adorned with tubular, two-lipped flowers in shades of pink to purple. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it well-suited for xeriscaping and rock gardens. Its nectar-rich flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and hummingbirds, enhancing its ecological value.
